lead_paragraph: DIAMANT--Joan Champion, died December 18 in Lenox, MA. Born in New York; studied at The Walden School and The Art Students League; worked at Pierre Matisse Gallery. Moved with second husband Lincoln Diamant to Ossining, NY, where she mastered bookbinding, then returned to painting. Ageless at 91, she was, like one of her Hudson Valley or Berkshire landscapes, the cynosure of any room. Survived by her son, Anthony Bruck, of Chicago; stepson, Rolf Diamant, and daughter-in-law Nora Mitchell, of Woodstock, VT. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  DIAMANT, JOAN CHAMPION
